snippet: Ace Speedway is a 56-year-old track in North Carolina that was once verging on collapse, weighed down by debt and dwindling attendance. But new management seems to be turning things around.
abstract: Ace Speedway, a small auto racetrack in North Carolina that has been operating since 1956, was once verging on collapse, weighed down by debt and dwindling attendance; Russian-American real-estate developer Abraham Woidislawsky bought the track in 2006 and, along with general manager Brad Allen, is slowly turning things around.
lead_paragraph: Ace Speedway is a 56-year-old track in North Carolina that was once verging on collapse, weighed down by debt and dwindling attendance. But new management seems to be turning things around.

headline.seo: A Wary Détente That Saved a Track From Extinction
headline.main: The Wary Détente That Saved a Racetrack From Extinction
headline.print_headline: The Wary Détente That Saved a Racetrack From Extinction
